body:
According to the [documentation on spack find](http://software.llnl.gov/spack/basic_usage.html#spack-find):

> `spack find -l +debug` will find every installed package with a ‘debug’ compile-time option enabled.

But this is not true. Spack currently requires a package name. Until this functionality is enabled, I'm going to remove this text from the documentation so as not to confuse new users.

This bug was discovered while working on #1576. It will be fixed in #1576. This issue is being opened to track the problem.
title: Documentation: spack find says it doesn't need a package name, but it does
